title: A Phase II Study of Immunotherapy in Elderly Patients with Advanced Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer

key_endpoints.name: Objective Response Rate
key_endpoints.description: Proportion of patients achieving complete or partial response per RECIST 1.1

key_endpoints.name: Patient-Reported Outcomes
key_endpoints.description: Quality of life assessed using PRO-CTCAE

additional_instructions:
STUDY POPULATION & SAFETY:
- Require COVID-19 vaccination or recent negative PCR test
- Include telemedicine visits for patients unable to travel
- Allow home nursing visits for frail elderly patients
- Screen for geriatric syndromes (falls, cognitive impairment, polypharmacy)

BIOMARKERS & DIAGNOSTICS:
- Mandatory PD-L1 biomarker testing with TPS threshold â‰¥50%
- Include ctDNA blood testing for molecular response monitoring
- Perform baseline and serial tumor genomic profiling

ASSESSMENTS:
- Use virtual tumor board for complex response assessments
- Include geriatric assessment tools: G8 screening, Charlson Comorbidity Index, ADL/IADL
- Add patient-reported outcomes (PRO-CTCAE) at every visit
- Monitor for immune-related adverse events with enhanced tracking
- Integrate wearable devices for continuous vitals monitoring (heart rate, oxygen saturation)

VISIT SCHEDULE:
- More frequent early visits (every 2 weeks for first 8 weeks) for elderly safety
- Allow flexible scheduling windows for patient convenience
- Include optional telemedicine check-ins between site visits

CRF DATA COLLECTION:
- Capture detailed biomarker results (PD-L1 TPS score, testing date, laboratory)
- Include fields for telemedicine visit quality metrics
- Add comprehensive geriatric functional status measures
- Record wearable device data and integration success
- Track COVID-19 status and vaccination dates
